main_definition: Option refers to a choice or alternative that can be selected from among various possibilities, often used in the context of decision-making, product features, or actions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A selection available for a particular situation
meanings_and_examples.example: I have two options: I can either take the bus to work or cycle.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The right or privilege of choosing among alternatives
meanings_and_examples.example: Having multiple payment options (cash, card, installments) is helpful for customers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A provision in a contract that allows one party to terminate the agreement under certain conditions
meanings_and_examples.example: The option clause allowed us to back out of the deal if we found another job offer within 30 days.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An add-on feature or enhancement for a product or service
meanings_and_examples.example: Our internet package comes with several options, such as ad-free streaming and high-speed data plans.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A choice between different courses of action in dealing with a situation
meanings_and_examples.example: The doctor presented me with two treatment options: surgery or medication.
